meanings.definition: A disease caused by a parasite transmitted by mosquitoes, characterized by fever and chills.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with malaria after the fever and chills.
meanings.sent2: Many people in tropical regions suffer from malaria due to mosquito bites.
meanings.sent3: Why did the mosquito invite the parasite to a party? Because it wanted to cause malaria!
meanings.sent4: The spread of misinformation is like a swarm of mosquitoes carrying the parasite of malaria.
meanings.sent5: In my dream, I saw a giant mosquito spreading malaria across the land.

meanings.definition: A fever caused by the presence of malaria parasites in the blood.
meanings.sent1: The nurse monitored the patient's malaria fever closely.
meanings.sent2: The presence of malaria parasites in the blood can lead to severe illness.
meanings.sent3: Why did the blood cell refuse to play hide and seek with the malaria parasite? It didn't want to catch a fever!
meanings.sent4: The intensity of the fever felt like a swarm of malaria parasites taking over.
meanings.sent5: The image of the malaria parasite in the blood was as vivid as a red alert warning.
